title: Integrating Vehicle Acoustic Data for Enhanced Urban Traffic Management: A Study on Speed Classification in Suzhou
author: Pengfei Fan (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Yuli Zhang (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Xinheng Wang (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Ruiyuan Jiang (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Hankang Gu (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Dongyao Jia (Xi'an Jiaotong-Liverpool University), Shangbo Wang (University of Sussex), ...,
relevance_why: The paper presents methods for analyzing vehicle noise, which can be leveraged for audio data processing tasks like noise reduction and speed classification in real-world applications.
background: The task involves classifying vehicle speeds based on acoustic data collected in an urban environment, using deep learning techniques.
contribution: This study introduces the Suzhou Urban Road Acoustic Dataset (SZUR-Acoustic Dataset) and a bimodal-feature-fusion deep convolutional neural network (BMCNN) to solve the problem of speed classification from vehicular acoustic data, achieving an accuracy of 87.56%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing speed measurement systems include radar and LiDAR but suffer from limitations under certain conditions, such as high traffic density or environmental factors.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes a combined approach that fuses Mel-frequency cepstral coefficients (MFCCs) and wavelet-packet energy features through a cross-modal attention mechanism, enhance accuracy and robustness.

key_innovation: Implements a unique bimodal-feature-fusion architecture that extracts and combines complementary acoustic features effectively to improve speed classification performance.
real_world_impact: The method can be integrated into smart city systems for real-time traffic management and noise pollution reduction, contributing to urban sustainability.
limitations: The study mentions challenges related to environmental interference and the need for comprehensive datasets.

new_terms.bimodal-feature-fusion: **Bimodal-feature-fusion** refers to the integration of features derived from two different modalities (in this case, MFCCs and wavelet-packet energy) to optimize performance in a machine learning task.

open_sourcing: The SZUR-Acoustic Dataset is publicly released to facilitate further research and reproducibility.
